Morecambe manager Jim Bentley was moved to tears by a kind gesture from the Shrimps fans who decided to pay his FA fine. 
The 40-year-old, who signed for Morecambe as a defender in 2002 before becoming player-manager and then boss, was sent to the stands against Cheltenham Town on December 17. 
Bentley was frustrated when Morecambe's Alex Kenyon was dismissed for his reaction to a challenge by Kyle Storer in the 2-1 defeat. 
He made his opinion felt and requested a personal hearing, but was instead handed a two-match touchline ban and was hit with a fine. Jim Bentley is presented with £1,000 to pay his FA fine (Photo: Morecambe Football Club/ YouTube) 
The ban meant Bentley missed his side's last game against Notts County, which they won 4-1, but was present for the press conference, where the fans had a surprise for him. 
As the above video shows, the supporters acknowledged that £1,000 is a hefty fine and wanted to show their appreciation for their loyal boss. The Morecambe manager is moved by the gesture (Photo: Morecambe Football Club/ YouTube) Bentley has been with the Shrimps since 2002 (Photo: Harry Trump / Getty) 
Organising a whip-round, the fans raised the money and presented it to the popular manager as a way of saying thank you for everything he has done for the club. 
The amazing video shows just what the gesture means to Bentley, and just how grateful he is, as he fights back the tears. Like us on Facebook
